reviews.review:
ЛУЧШАЯ ИГРА ПОСЛЕДНЕГО ТЫСЯЧЕЛЕТИЯ!
ОЦЕНИВАЮ НА 36/10

One of the most famous PC shootes in existence

The game gives you 5 guns and puts you again in the shoes of Gordon Freeman to fight aliens, much like in the first game, but there's not much more in common between the two. Instead of the indoor corridors of a base you now make your way across the russian countryside, complete with beaches, forests, plains and a river, until you arrive to the city at the end. The environment *seems* open, but it's jut a long corridor. A varied corridor though. There are also vehicle sections, but I found those less enjoyable than the rest of the game.

The story takes a jump from the previous game, both in terms of time and current events, and the game does not really do a good job at explaining it to you. Everyone is talking between them and then they tell you to go do this so that can happen. It is recommended to look up the details yourself after beating it. Also, there aren't any cutscenes in this game, all the scenes happen during the gameplay (not the shooting, mind you).

All the enemy soldiers have an instantly recognizeable scruffy voice while the friendly NPCs sound more calmed and soft, for the most part. This game also has some os the most well known scores for PC games (like the Nuclear Mission jam), and the weapon sounds are very well made.

The graphics, although impressive for the time this came out, are showing their age. The art direction is fantastic though, with very cool designs for anything alien related. All the weapons are unique and instantly recognizable.

The Episodes continue with the same trends as the main game, with the exception of more focus on the Gravity Gun during Episode 1. There are no radical differences between them and the main game.

Overall, I have to admit I did not like this game that much. I can see that it is a good game obviously, but it didn't ring the excitement bell like others have. I still recommend everybody to play it though, this is one of those in the "must play" list.

El mejor fps que he jugado nunca, supera incluso al primero. Le da mil patadas en la boca a cualquier fps mediocre de hoy en día.

Bon jeu dans l'ensemble mais quelques points noirs a bien appuyer car handicapants dans le jeu :
- Les suiveurs : Généralement trop nombreux, ce qui est particulièrement gènant dans les endroits étroits ou il faut échaper aux coups. Sachant qu'on ne passe pas a travers, il arrive plus que trop souvent de vouloir échaper a une grenade, et de se retrouver piégé par ses propres équipiers. Donnez une intelligence a ces pauvres bêtes.
- Les épisodes "véhicules" : Particulièrement longs, simples, sans trop d'interet, bref, assez ennuyant. Celui avec le jetski est encore bien pensé, mais celui avec le buggy est aggacent dans le sens ou le moindre obstacle bloque la voiture si les quatre roues n'y sont pas. En bref, si on se retrouves sur une branche on doit descendre du véhicule, le pousser avec le pistolet anti-gravité, et remonter dedans. Cela prend approximativement une minute et 50 points de vie sachant que les Fourmilions vous attaquent en masse dès que vous n'ètes plus en mouvement.

Sinon, bon jeu. Dommage qu'il n'y ai pas plus de monstres, c'est ce qui faisais l'âme de HL premier du nom. Celui ci est très bien aussi, meme si je ne l'ai pas encore fini. Je n'ai pas lu de soluce, ni vu de vidéo, j'espère etre surprise par la fin de cet opus que je voulais finir depuis longtemps ^^

Best game ever 10/10

Having not played the first installment, I went into this game with absolutely no knowledge about what the game was about. I enjoyed the immersive dystopian world that the game throws you in. The evident struggle and poverty the citizens of City 17 (and the outer regions) encouraged you to really help put an end to the Combines grasp on the people. The game was not distrupted by cut scenes, which in most games often have better animations / graphics than the actual game itself, but rather, in Half Life 2 the game and cut scenes flow as one. It made the game that more enjoyable and helped the story to flow. I found the main characters relatable and began to really care about them (including the many Rebels and Antlions who joined me along the way. R.I.P). The relationships between the characters seemed believable and natural, which added to the connecton you, the player, develops. Gameplay was diverse, whether it be driving numerous vehicles, being out numbered by Combine Soldiers, taking on Stryders or Commanding a group of Antlions. I was never bored, it's quite impossible to when the action and story is so rich and constant. The world was pretty but also visibly changed by the neglect, conflict and change that had occured over time during the Combine Invasion. There was plenty of mystery especially the end. You gain background story as the game progresses adding to your knowledge of history of current events. I found it an incredible game and an engaging story and as a keen player of FPS games I was not disappointed. I defiantly reccomend this game to anyone who hasn't played it. I can't believe it took me 10 years to even discover this game, then again I was 9 when it game out.

La historia de lo mejor, muchas preguntas e incógnitas que aun no se resuelven que espero (y varios) tengan respuesta para el Half Life 3 o Half Life 2 Ep. 3 (Si es que sale).
El sistema de juego es excelente, no sólo es disparar, matar, correr, etc (cofcofHaloGearOfWarscofcof) aunque sí tiene su lado FPS tambien tiene sus "puzzles" donde podrías quedar trabado en uno que otro lugar.


Sin duda algo que recomiendo totalmente por su sistema de juego e historia.
Definetally Buy.

O jogo consegue ser divertido mesmo 10 anos depois de ser lançado, é simplesmente fantástico. A engine Source tem uma das melhores físicas vistas até hoje, e o visual gráfico, para a época, é magnífico. Até hoje não deixa a desejar. Eu joguei diversos FPS, e do mesmo ano, 2004, poderia citar CoD: United Offensive e Medal of Honor: Pacific Assault. Jogos que não conseguem, em nenhum aspecto, ser superiores a HL 2. Desconsiderando comparações absurdas com games da uma, duas gerações de consoles a frente, o jogo é simplesmente sem igual. O enredo enigmático e personagens carismáticos, que mesmo jogando pela quinta vez ainda me surpreende com um ou outro detalhe que deixei passar despercebido das outras vezes que joguei, consegue trazer uma atmosfera bem mais imersiva que a do primeiro jogo. 

As críticas negativas de outros usuários são irrelevantes a partir do momento que não consideram data de lançamento antes de argumentar, ou então se baseiam em trechos para dizer que o game inteiro não vale a pena. Qualquer um pode ver quando o jogo foi lançado. Se o cidadão não quer um jogo "velho", porque comprar? Não vi outro FPS que conseguisse competir com Half Life 2 até o lançamento de BioShock em 2007. E enquanto dizem que o jogo não vale a pena pelo capítulo Water Hazard, esse é um dos meus preferidos (sério!). Depois de aprender a pilotar o airboat e mirar, não há dificuldade tão absurda nessa fase, não sejamos escandalosos. As pessoas estão tão acostumadas com jogos fáceis, com tudo mastigado, que quando vem um jogo mais complicado, ou trecho mais complicado, já é o suficiente pra dizer que o jogo não presta. Eu por exemplo não gosto das fases com antlions, mas isso não influencia na magnificência do produto final.

Conclusão: se você quer aproveitar um clássico, já tendo em mente quando o jogo foi lançado e as limitações da época, o que você tá esperando? 11/10, recomendo com toda certeza!

Half-Life 2 is a masterpiece of a game. The storyline is so strong, it never gets old, or outdated. This game was, and is a major turning point in the gaming community, and will always be a classic. I strongly reccomend you don't waste your time reading reviews and play this game...

*Starts up Half Life 2* "Sigh, time to get this piece of crap over with...." *20 minutes later* "HOLY BALLS NO WONDER EVERYBODY LIKES THIS!" 

To tell you the truth i thought this would be Half-A-Crap 2 and only bought it to fill in the missing texture problems i had with Garry's mod, boy was i wrong, This is THE best and most immersive game money can buy!
Everything is good about this game, the soundtrack is just perfect and gives you a adrenaline rush that will tape you to your chair, gameplay is fluid and very immersive, hell, I'd be willing enough to stand around every single character in the game just to hear every piece of dialog they have to say.

Now ask your self the question, why waste money on a game that you will never touch when you can have the most fun and story driven experience that will dominate your steam libary page and your heart? I know what i'll be doing.... ;)

Was soll man schon groß sagen zu diesem Spiel. Es ist ein digitales Meisterwerk und zeigt noch immer, dass Videospiele mehr sind als "nur" bloße Unterhaltung. Die Grafik war damals ein Augenschmaus und ließ mich durchgehend staunen. Mimiken und Gefühle der Charaktere wurden so gut rüber gebracht, wie ich es damals noch nie gesehen habe. Beinahe zeitnah bot Doom 3 ebenfalls eine grandiose Grafik. Doch wo id's Doom 3 vor allem gewohntes Gameplay bot und die neue (Grafik)Engine präsentierte, zeigte Half-Life 2 was Ego-Shooter spielerisch mehr bieten können: Passende und nicht aufgesetzt wirkende Physikrätsel, eine fesselnde Fortsetzung der Story des Vorgängers, eine perfekt aufeinander abgestimmte Welt, die eine unglaubliche Atmosphäre schafft, die noch immer fesselt. Und es in Zukunft wahrscheinlich immer noch tun wird.

Danke für die vielen Stunden mit Gordon und Alyx, Valve! Danke für die grandiose Fortsetzung eines schon genialen ersten Teils. Danke für den meiner Meinung nach bis dato bestem Spiel.

(Bitte nicht falsch verstehen: Doom 3 habe ich damals sehr gerne gespielt und ich habe mir auch ohne Zögern vor paar Monaten noch mal die BFG-Edition für meine Xbox 360 gekauft. Nur ist es eben nicht ganz so genial wie Half-Life 2.)

Half-life 2, es el tipico juego que juegas una vez y te deja impactado, el misterio, los personajes y el ambiente hacen que Half-life 2 sea un juego que quedras revivir mas de una vez, en lo personal me encantan los giños entre juegos, y no saben como actue al enterarme de que giños tiene este juego ademas de los misterios ocultos que te dicen "hey y donde encaja esto? por que esta esto aqui? esa curiosidad hace que Half-life 2 sea un juego memorable ademas de sus multiples esenarios donde no solo ponen a prueba tu destreza si no tambien tu inteligencia, solo puedo decirles que este juego vivira mucho tiempo mas....

O jogo dá a continuidade à história de Half-Life, logo após Freeman ser contratado novamente pelo misterioso G-Man. Usando a engine Source, e todas as suas vantagens de físicas e gráficos simples, porém extremamente bonitos, Half-Life 2 cumpre com a necessidade de dar uma ótima continuidade à história. O jogo começa a adicionar personagens que lhe acompanham a maior parte da campanha, tais como Alyx, Barney e Eli, que são extremamente carismáticos, e que realmente lhe faz criar uma forte afeição por eles. Ainda adicionando um novo antagonista, e vários outros inimigos, em um universo distópico onde a unica coisa que resta é lutar por seus direitos, criando uma resistencia contra tudo o que está acontecendo. O uso da engine Source foi extremamente ótimo. A imersão ao personagem que você controla consegue ser ainda mais intensa, e os desafios que você encara passando pelo vasto mundo em que é colocado são incrivelmente divertidos e desafiadores.
One of the best games ever! I rarely find linear games with this much replay value.  This is actually one of the best games ever conceived by man.

I did not get to play Half-Life 2 until about 2011.  That is the first time, after expressing great love for Portal (which I bought on friggin DVD at Target in 2008) that a friend of mine said "You.  Half-Life.  Make it happen."

And I did.

Eight years after the game was released, I was 10,000% floored by the game mechanics, the engine, the physics, and the dystopian feel.  It was incredible.  I had played Half-Life by that point, and while it was fun, it was dated.  Half-Life 2 even now looks and feels like it isn't all that old.  It still looks and sounds great, and the coding is a tribute to Valve's tenacity.

The gravity gun needs no explanation except to say that it is truly the most unique weapon I have ever used in a game.  The Portal gun is fun, but the ridiculous things the gravity gun is capable of doing on a now 12 year old game engine are nothing short of amazing.

When one of my closest friends built her first gaming computer (like a week ago), my first though was that I'd hit the holiday sale.  She is now the proud owner of the Orange Box and Portal 2 for all of the reasons obvious to everyone who loves this game.

FPS can be immersive, involve problem solving, and require strategy.  I know this because this one does.  FPS does not have to involve stupid kids screaming expletives and slurs at each other over a headset on December 26.  FPS can be a person, unique experience.  Half-Life 2 is very much that.

STOP READING THIS AND GO BUY IT!  But if you're going to buy it know that it goes on sale regularly, so you might save a few dollars.  The Orange Box is a graet way to go.

BEST FPS EVER

This ranks up there with Ocarina of Time and a small number of other very significant titles who simply should be played (at least once) by every person on earth, at least once in their lives.

There are reasons why this game is in almost every "best games of all time" list: it's immersive to the point of transporting you to Freeman's world (even gets uncomfortable at times, like Ravenholm etc), never gets repetitive (even though you're basically just shooting sh*t up), feels-sounds-looks unique in every aspect you try to see it and still has brilliant and incredibly precise playability, it rewards skill like Counter Strike does, but with a universe not less colorful than Zelda's.

This is a trip, I'm glad I picked this up last Christmas and played it through, a little bit at a time (as I had time and the desire to), until finishing it today. Felt great all the way through.

Gordon Freeman is Valve's Super Mario, just brilliant and a very remarkable experience.

Um jogo não se torna tão venerado atoa! Mesmo 10 anos depois Half-Life 2 ainda bota muito fps "da nova geração" para comer grama tanto em jogabilidade como em (principalmente, diria eu) história.

É um jogo OBRIGATÓRIO a todo Gamer que se preze.
